intro: Haplophloga comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Its bulbs are an important part of its life cycle, storing nutrients for periods of drought. Haplophloga comorensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and cultural significance in the region.
